intro: Leontodon hispidulus var. tenuilobus, commonly known as the narrow-lobed hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and rocky soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are hairy and have narrow, lobed edges, giving it a distinctive appearance. The yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
